memberdef.argsstring: (const char *base_path, const char *tag, size_t rows, size_t cols, size_t blk_k, char *out_buf, size_t out_cap)
memberdef.name: ie_layout_cache_name

briefdescription.para: Create a filename for the on-disk cache of a blocked matrix.

detaileddescription.para: The generated name is deterministic and includes the structural parameters so that changes in shape or block-size naturally invalidate older caches.

parameterdescription.para: Path or stem to namespace the cache (may be NULL/empty).
Short, human-readable tag (e.g., "wxh", "woh").
Row count in the logical matrix.
Column count in the logical matrix.
Column block size used for packing.
Destination buffer for the resulting path.
Capacity of out_buf in bytes (including NUL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; -1 on invalid arguments or buffer too small.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *path, size_t rows, size_t cols, float **data_out)
memberdef.name: load_cache

briefdescription.para: Load a blocked buffer from disk cache into a freshly malloc'ed array.

detaileddescription.para: The function validates the payload length by expecting exactly rows*cols floats. It does not validate content beyond size and returns the raw buffer as-is.

parameterdescription.para: Cache file path (may be NULL to force a miss).
Expected number of rows.
Expected number of cols.
On success, *data_out points to a malloc'ed float array of length rows*cols the caller owns.

simplesect.para: 0 on a successful load; -1 on any error (including cache miss).

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *path, const float *data, size_t rows, size_t cols)
memberdef.name: save_cache_atomic

briefdescription.para: Save a blocked buffer to disk cache using an atomic rename.

detaileddescription.para: The function writes to a temporary file "<path>.tmp" and then renames it to path. If any step fails, the temporary file is unlinked.

parameterdescription.para: Destination file path.
Source buffer (length rows*cols floats).
Number of rows.
Number of cols.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, size_t rows, size_t cols, size_t blk_k, const char *cache_path, ie_wblocked_desc_t *out)
memberdef.name: ie_layout_build_blockedK

briefdescription.para: Build a per-row Blocked-K layout from a row-major matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Allocate and build a blocked-K copy of row-major W.

Layout definition (per row): For k0 in {0, blk_k, 2*blk_k, ...} copy the contiguous slice W[r, k0 .. k0 + klen - 1] where klen = min(blk_k, cols - k0) into the destination row buffer. The order of elements within a row is unchanged, merely grouped by contiguous blk_k segments.

Performance note:
This packing does not introduce padding; the last block is short.
Consumers can use blk_k as an inner-loop tile when iterating K.

Cache interaction:
If cache_path is non-NULL and a readable file exists with exactly rows*cols floats, the function loads it and returns immediately.
Otherwise the function computes the layout, attempts to save it atomically to cache_path (if provided), and returns the new buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to row-major input matrix (rows x cols).
Number of rows in W.
Number of columns in W.
Column block size (>= 1).
Optional filename for cache read/write (may be NULL).
Output descriptor to be filled on success.

simplesect.para: 0 on success (with out->data != NULL); -1 on invalid args or OOM.

briefdescription.para: Release a blocked descriptor and reset its fields.

detaileddescription.para: Free resources owned by a blocked descriptor.
Safe to call with NULL. After the call, desc fields are zeroed.

parameterdescription.para: Descriptor pointer (may be NULL).
